title: Śutudrī to Satadru: Sutlej Avulsions & the Sarasvatī Question
summary: How a Himalayan river abandoned the Ghaggar–Hakra and what that means for Vedic to Harappan geographies.

claims.text: The Ghaggar–Hakra palaeovalley records an abandoned course of the Himalayan-fed Sutlej prior to Mature Harappan urbanism.
Harappan-period flows on the Ghaggar were predominantly monsoon-fed rather than perennial glacial discharge.

texts.excerpt: Śutudrī and Vipāśā are named among the rivers.

title: Satisar Remembered: Karewa Lakefill & Jhelum Outlet
summary: Nilamata's memory of Satisar (a great lake) aligns with Kashmir Valley's lacustrine Karewa deposits and later incision via the Jhelum gorge.

claims.text: Plio–Pleistocene Karewa Group records long-lived lacustrine–deltaic sedimentation in the Kashmir basin.
Subsequent incision at the Baramulla gorge enabled basin drainage, consistent with a lake-to-valley transition.

texts.excerpt: Satisar, once a vast lake, is drained by sage Kaśyapa.

title: Earth–Sea Saṅgam: Shoreline Change and Ancient Ports
summary: Textual memories of harbours (Puhār/Kāveripūmpattinam, Dvārakā) examined alongside bathymetry, anchors and coastal change.

claims.text: Offshore surveys near Poompuhar record submerged structures and a migrated shoreline along the Cauvery delta.
Marine archaeology off Dwarka/Bet Dwarka has documented stone/lead anchors and cultural material associated with harbour activity.

texts.excerpt: A bustling seaport where ships crowd the estuary at Kāveripūmpattinam.
